17.summary:
The document outlines various discount programs available for diabetic supplies, physical therapy, and hearing services. For diabetic supplies, customers can receive discounts ranging from 20% to 85% off retail prices. This includes brand name glucose test strips, glucose monitors, lancets, and other devices such as blood pressure monitors and urinalysis test strips. The program provides a customer service contact number and a billing number for inquiries and support.

In the physical therapy and rehabilitation section, the document highlights an average savings of 20% at over 1,200 offices with 4,000 rehabilitation and physical therapy providers across 23 states. This section also provides contact information for customer service and billing inquiries.

The hearing savings program offers free hearing consultations and exclusive discounts on the latest hearing aid technology. Benefits include free annual hearing consultations at over 3,000 hearing professional locations, exclusive discounts on all hearing aid technologies and styles, a free deluxe warranty program, and up to a 3-year supply of batteries, with 40 cells provided per hearing aid purchased per year. Contact details for customer service and billing are also provided for this program.

18.summary:
The document outlines a medical bill negotiation program designed to assist members in reducing medical expenses that are not covered by their existing plan benefits. Patient advocates are available to negotiate on behalf of members to lower the cost of medical bills. To initiate the negotiation process, a minimum bill amount of $5000 is required, and full payment to the provider or facility must be made upon acceptance of the negotiation. This service is not provided by AccessOne DMPO. 

Additionally, the document details a discount program for medical supplies and equipment, offering savings ranging from 20% to 50% on various medical supply needs. The program includes a wide selection of items such as ambulatory aids, bathroom safety items, wheelchairs, scooters, and hospital beds. Contact information for customer service and billing is provided, along with a website link for accessing the program and locating providers.

19.summary:
The Laboratory Savings Program provides an efficient, affordable, and confidential solution for medical laboratory testing. Members can access a wide array of medical laboratory tests, gain information on tests and diseases, and purchase lab tests directly from the website. However, this program is not available in New York, New Jersey, or Rhode Island. The program is not insurance but a discount program, emphasizing its role in cost reduction rather than coverage. 

SDO Nutrition offers support for achieving personal health goals, maintaining a healthy lifestyle, and managing chronic health conditions through food and diet education. The services include weight loss, dietary restrictions, geriatric health, diabetes and high blood pressure management, chronic health conditions management, and nutrition for athletic and fitness training. This program also operates as a discount service, not as insurance, focusing on providing educational and supportive resources rather than direct medical coverage.

20.summary:
The document outlines two distinct services: speech therapy and a 24/7 nurse help line. The speech therapy service utilizes video conferencing technology to deliver live, one-on-one, highly individualized, and interactive sessions. This telepractice model offers an alternative to traditional therapy, requiring only a computer, high-speed internet, a web camera, and a quiet room. Sessions are pre-scheduled, and therapists use therapeutic activities and exercises to engage with clients. Additional materials and follow-up resources are provided to help patients practice skills learned during sessions.

The 24/7 nurse help line offers round-the-clock access to registered nurses (RNs) for family health inquiries. This service includes medical information assistance in over 100 languages, ensuring broad accessibility. Both services emphasize ease of access and are not provided by AccessOne DMPO. Contact information for customer service and billing is provided, along with a website for program access and provider location.

21.summary:
The Chiropractic Savings Program provides a free initial consultation and offers up to 50% savings on diagnostic services and x-rays if necessary. Members can also benefit from unlimited treatments with up to 30% savings through a national network of over 12,000 chiropractors. This program is designed to make chiropractic care more affordable and accessible. 

In addition to chiropractic services, the program includes discounts on vitamins and supplements. Members can save up to 75% off retail pricing on a wide selection of natural products, including vitamins and supplements. This aspect of the program aims to support overall health and wellness by making essential health products more affordable. 

The program is not provided by AccessOne DMPO and is explicitly stated as a discount program, not insurance. For further assistance or to locate providers, members are directed to contact customer service or visit the specified website.

22.summary:
The document outlines the terms and conditions of the Health Discount Program Member Agreement provided by AccessOne Consumer Health, Inc. It specifies that the plan is not insurance but offers discounts at certain healthcare providers for medical services. Members are responsible for paying for all healthcare services, with discounts applied by contracted providers. The plan includes discounts on services from chiropractors, medical equipment suppliers, rehabilitation services, hearing services, labs, and pharmacies, with discounts ranging from 5% to 70%. Dental and vision services are also discounted, with dental discounts ranging from 15-50% per visit and vision services available at discounts of 5% to 50%.

The agreement details the effective date of enrollment, which is shown on the Member ID, and the process for cancellation. Members can cancel their participation within thirty days for a full refund of membership fees, minus a processing fee if applicable. After thirty days, cancellation is possible with a pro-rata refund for unused months. The plan allows for the addition of dependent children at no extra charge. Members are billed at the time services are provided, and discounts are applied by the participating provider.

The document emphasizes that the plan is not intended to replace health insurance and does not meet minimum creditable coverage requirements. It is not a Qualified Health Plan under the Affordable Care Act and is not a Medicare prescription drug plan. Members are advised to keep a copy of the agreement for their records.

23.summary: This page provides information about a discount program offered by the National Benefit Builders, Inc. It is important to note that this program is not an insurance plan but rather a discount program. The page is intended for agent use only and includes branding elements such as the NCE logo and the Better Business Bureau accreditation. The document emphasizes that the program is designed to offer discounts on various services, although specific details about the discounts or services covered are not provided on this page. The page serves as a placeholder or introductory slide, likely part of a larger presentation or document that would detail the program's offerings and benefits in subsequent sections.

9.summary:
The Discount Benefit Program Member Handbook provides an overview of the benefits available to members, emphasizing the inclusion of limited medical benefits alongside valuable discount benefits. This program is designed to offer members access to a range of discounts on various services, enhancing the value of their membership. The handbook highlights that this is not an insurance program but a discount program, which is important for members to understand when considering their healthcare options.

Members can expect to receive discounts on medical services, which can help reduce out-of-pocket expenses. The program is structured to complement existing medical coverage by providing additional savings opportunities. The handbook serves as a guide for members to navigate the benefits available to them, ensuring they can maximize the value of their membership.

It is important to note that the program is for agent use only, indicating that it is intended to be used as a resource for those selling or managing the program. The handbook does not provide detailed coverage limits or cost structures, as it focuses on the discount aspect rather than traditional insurance coverage.

10.summary:
This document serves as the table of contents for a health discount program, outlining various services and savings opportunities available to members. The program includes a range of benefits such as dental and vision services, pharmacy discounts, and brand-name mail-order options. Additionally, members can access savings on CBD products, diabetic supplies, and physical therapy and rehabilitation services. The program also offers a hearing savings program and medical bill negotiation services to help manage healthcare costs effectively.

Further benefits include access to medical supplies and equipment, laboratory savings programs, and nutrition services. Speech therapy and a 24/7 nurse help line are also available to support members' health needs. The chiropractic savings plan and discounts on vitamins and supplements provide additional wellness options. Finally, the health discount program member agreement outlines the terms and conditions of membership, ensuring members understand their benefits and responsibilities.

11.summary:
The GapAfford Plus program is designed to help individuals and families save on out-of-pocket medical expenses, regardless of their current insurance status. It offers savings from the first dollar spent, with no limits, providing access to pre-negotiated lower rates similar to those received by insurance companies. This program is particularly beneficial for those with high deductible health plans, no insurance, or those who are under-insured. It also caters to individuals who cannot obtain insurance due to pre-existing conditions, those whose plans do not cover certain procedures, and those in their eligibility waiting period or on COBRA. Notably, everyone is approved without the need for a medical exam.

The program does not include deductibles, pre-existing condition limitations, medical exams, claim forms, usage limitations, or age restrictions, except for work already in progress. It is a reduced fee-for-service program and not an insurance plan. All household members are included, regardless of age, including students away at college. Individuals with existing insurance can still enroll, provided their provider accepts both the insurance and the program. Participants must pay for services at the time they are rendered, and discounts are available when using participating providers. The program does not meet the requirements of the PPACA and is not available in certain states, including Alaska, Montana, Rhode Island, Utah, Vermont, and Washington.

12.summary:
The document outlines the benefits of the GapAfford Plus program, which provides access to the Aetna Dental Access network. This network includes over 262,000 dental practice locations across the United States, offering significant savings on dental services. Members can expect to save between 15-50% per visit on services such as cleanings, x-rays, fillings, root canals, crowns, bridges, and orthodontia. The program highlights several advantages, including no waiting periods, no age restrictions, and no pre-existing condition exclusions, except for work already in progress. Additionally, there are no benefit maximums, and members do not need to file paperwork or claim forms. Cosmetic dentistry and orthodontia are included, and the program can be used alongside existing dental insurance to enhance coverage. Vision discounts are also available.

The document provides a sample table of dental care savings, comparing the regional average costs by Aetna with the costs under the Dentachoice program. For example, a periodic oral exam costs $73 on average, but with Dentachoice, it is reduced to $35, resulting in a total savings of $38. Other procedures, such as comprehensive oral exams, x-rays, and fillings, also show significant savings. The table includes a disclaimer that prices can change without notice and that actual costs and savings may vary by provider and location. The Dentachoice Dental and Vision Program is administered by Aetna Life Insurance Company, but ALIC does not offer or administer the program directly.

13.summary:
The OUTLOOK Vision network offers a wide range of discounts and savings through a network of over 12,000 eye care locations nationwide. This program provides savings of 10% to 50% on most prescription eyeglasses, frames, and lenses. Additionally, there are savings on contact lenses, excluding disposables, at participating retail locations. Discounts of 10% to 30% are also available on medical eye exams and surgical procedures such as PRK and LASIK, where available and approved.

The document includes a sample vision care savings table, showcasing potential savings at various locations. For example, at Exact Eye Care in Kearney, NE, a frame single vision with polycarbonate is available at a retail price of $129.00, with a member price of $90.30, resulting in a savings of 30%. Similar savings are detailed for other locations and items, illustrating the potential financial benefits for members.

A list of some participating vision care providers is also provided, including well-known names such as Pearle Vision, Sears Optical, and Lenscrafters, among others. This extensive network ensures that members have access to a wide range of services and providers across the country.

14.summary:
The pharmacy discount card offers significant savings on prescription medications, allowing users to save an average of 55% on generic drugs and 15% on brand-name drugs. This card is accepted at over 80% of pharmacies across the United States, providing a wide national network for users. All FDA-approved drugs, including lifestyle medications, are available at reduced rates. There is no limit on the number of prescriptions that can be filled using this card, and it includes coverage for pet medications as well.

The card is pre-activated and never expires, allowing immediate use without the need for any forms or activation processes. It covers the entire household with no exclusions, ensuring that all family members can benefit from the discounts. Importantly, personal information is never collected from the card user, maintaining privacy and security.

To utilize the discounts, members simply present their member ID card to the pharmacist along with their prescription. The program emphasizes ease of use and accessibility, with no additional steps required to access the benefits. This discount card is not an insurance plan but a program designed to reduce the cost of medications for users.

15.summary:
This page outlines the RX Mail-Order program offered by MedAfford Global, which provides significant savings on prescription medications. Customers can save up to 80% on prescription medications, with insulin medication savings of 45% or more. The process is designed to be convenient, easy, and secure. To participate, customers must first price their medication through the provided website link. Orders can be placed online or by calling the specified phone number, and a valid prescription from a doctor is required. Once the order is placed, medications are shipped directly to the customer, with email confirmation provided.

The page includes a list of commonly ordered brand-name medications with their average prices based on a 90-day supply. For example, Abilify 10mg is priced at $160, Advair Diskus 50/250mcg 180 doses at $144, and Eliquis 5mg 180 tabs at $236. Additionally, commonly ordered generic medications are listed, such as Amlodipine 10mg for $20 and Lisinopril 20mg for $22. These prices do not include a $4.95 shipping fee or the cost of insurance for shipment. The program is administered by National Benefit Builders, Inc., and it is emphasized that this is a discount program, not insurance.

16.summary:
The document introduces the benefits of incorporating CBD into daily health routines, highlighting its natural ingredients and the purest form of Cannabidiol. It positions CBD as a safe and effective alternative to prescription painkillers for families and pets. CBD, or cannabidiol, is a compound found in hemp plants, known for supporting peace and balance without intoxication. The text emphasizes the non-altering effects of CBD, making it suitable for everyday use. CBD Afford selects vendors offering products that promote a healthier, plant-based future. The document acknowledges the complexity of CBD information and aims to be a resource for better health understanding.

The document outlines the unique aspects of their CBD products, including compliance with the Farm Bill Act of 2018 and the use of high-quality, pharmacist-formulated full-spectrum CBD products. It assures the purity and potency of ingredients, supported by multi-stage third-party lab testing. Additionally, each package includes QR codes linked to lab results, ensuring transparency and quality assurance.

1.summary: This document provides an overview of the insurance offerings by Everest Reinsurance Company, specifically focusing on the Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance plan. The plan is offered through NCE and utilizes the Multiplan PPO Network, providing a structured approach to healthcare coverage. The insurance type is designed to offer fixed benefits for specific medical services, allowing policyholders to manage their healthcare expenses effectively. The document highlights the carrier, Everest, and outlines the provider options available under this plan. The Multiplan PPO Network is emphasized as a key feature, offering a wide range of healthcare providers to choose from, which can help in reducing out-of-pocket costs for the insured. This plan is tailored to meet the needs of individuals seeking a fixed indemnity insurance solution, providing predictable benefits for covered services.

2.summary:
This page outlines the features and benefits of Group Indemnity Insurance, which provides fixed payments to help manage expenses arising from medical costs. The insurance is designed to supplement existing coverage and provide cash to cover medical and living expenses. An example is provided where a 35-year-old woman incurs expenses after an accident, including a hospital admission benefit of $1,000, an ER admission benefit of $100, a hospital confinement benefit of $2,000, and a physician office benefit of $75, totaling $3,175. 

The plan emphasizes flexibility, allowing payments to be used for major medical copays, deductibles, transportation, child care, and other needs. Everest Group Indemnity Insurance offers a Multiplan PPO Network, direct payment of benefits, and a fast claims process. However, it is noted that payouts are estimates and not guaranteed, with benefits varying by plan and individual circumstances. Terms, conditions, and exclusions apply, and the policy is not intended to substitute major medical coverage.

The document also highlights that some states may have minimum coverage requirements and advises consulting policy documents for a complete description of benefits, exclusions, and limitations.

3.summary:
The document provides detailed information on the Group Fixed Indemnity Plan options, specifically Plan 100, Plan 200, Plan 200+, and Plan 300. Each plan is designed with specific benefits and coverage limits, catering to different needs. All plans have a pre-existing condition limitation of 12 months, and they are guaranteed issue plans. Confinement benefits are structured to provide daily payments for hospital and ICU confinement, with Plan 100 offering $100 for hospital confinement and $200 for ICU, while Plan 300 offers $300 for both. Hospital benefits include emergency room visits, with a $50 coverage per visit across all plans. Plan 200+ and Plan 300 also cover surgery with a maximum of three days per certificate year, shared between inpatient and outpatient services, and provide anesthesia benefits at 25% coverage. Outpatient benefits vary, with Plan 100 offering $50 for physician's office visits, while Plan 200+ and Plan 300 include additional coverage for labs, X-rays, and advanced diagnostics. 

The document highlights specific limitations and exclusions. There is a pre-existing condition exclusion, defining a pre-existing condition as any condition for which medical treatment, diagnosis, or advice was received during the 12 months prior to the effective date of coverage. The plans do not cover chiropractic or acupuncture services. Benefits are limited to the amounts specified per person, and policy terms may vary by state. The document advises consulting the certificate for detailed terms, conditions, and limitations.

4.summary:
The document provides detailed information on the Group Fixed Indemnity Plan options, specifically comparing Plan 500, Plan 750, Plan 1000, and Plan 1000+. Each plan outlines specific benefits, coverage limits, and eligibility criteria. The plans include a pre-existing condition limitation of 12-12 months, meaning coverage for pre-existing conditions is limited for the first year. All plans are guaranteed issue, ensuring coverage without medical underwriting.

Confinement benefits vary by plan, with hospital confinement coverage ranging from $500 in Plan 500 to $1000 in Plan 1000+. ICU confinement benefits are similarly structured, with amounts increasing from $500 to $1000 across the plans. Hospital benefits include emergency room visits, with Plan 500 covering $50 per visit and Plan 1000+ covering $1000 per visit. Hospital admission benefits are only available in Plan 1000+ at $1000 per admission.

Procedure benefits cover surgery and anesthesia, with a maximum of three surgery days per certificate year shared between inpatient and outpatient services. Outpatient benefits include lab, X-rays, advanced diagnostics, and physician's office visits, with coverage amounts increasing from $50 in Plan 500 to $100 in Plan 1000+. The document also notes that there is no coverage for chiropractic or acupuncture services, and benefits are subject to state availability and specific policy terms.

5.summary:
This document provides an overview of the Everest Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance, a supplemental health plan that offers a fixed monetary benefit for specific covered medical expenses. It is also referred to as indemnity insurance or fee-for-service insurance. The plan allows members to access discounts through participating providers, which can be found at the specified website or by calling the provided number. Advanced diagnostics covered under this plan include a range of tests such as angiograms, CT scans, MRIs, and more. The document clarifies terms like 'Calendar Year,' which spans from January 1st to December 31st, and 'Certificate Year,' which aligns with the plan year in the Certificate Schedule. 

A 'free look period' is available, allowing the Certificate Holder to return the Certificate within 10 days of receipt for any reason. The concept of 'Confinement' is defined as being admitted to a hospital for inpatient services, with benefits paid per day of confinement. 'Diagnostic Care' encompasses a variety of medical procedures necessary for diagnosing medical conditions, including tests like X-rays and biopsies. The MultiPlan PPO Network is highlighted as a nationwide network providing additional provider options with agreed service discounts.

6.summary:
This document outlines the exclusions and limitations associated with the insurance plan, detailing specific services and treatments that are not covered. Expenses for any services, supplies, and treatments not considered Covered Benefitor Covered Services are excluded unless otherwise stated. Breast surgery, including capsular contraction, augmentation, or reduction mammoplasty, is not covered except for medically necessary reconstruction following a mastectomy due to cancer treatment. Certain services provided by individuals who do not typically charge for their services are also excluded unless there is a legal obligation to pay.

Cosmetic surgery is generally not covered, except when it is reconstructive and necessary due to trauma, infection, or disease. Dental care is excluded except for treatment due to accidental injury to sound natural teeth within 12 months of a covered accident. Elective surgeries and experimental or investigational treatments are not covered. Accidents resulting from participation in extreme sports or activities such as skydiving, bungee jumping, or mountaineering are excluded from coverage.

Treatments or services provided by a family member are not covered. Additionally, foreign travel expenses for treatment or services outside the United States are not covered unless incurred during an emergency and approved for use in the U.S. These exclusions highlight the specific conditions and scenarios where benefits are not payable under the plan.

7.summary:
This document outlines specific exclusions and limitations within an insurance plan, detailing conditions under which no benefits are payable. It specifies that no benefits are provided for treatments related to gender-related services, including gender reassignment and treatments to enhance sexual energy. Additionally, injuries sustained during hazardous activities or occupations, especially those involving compensation, are not covered. This includes activities like skiing, horse riding, and professional sports.

The plan also excludes coverage for losses resulting from illegal acts, incarceration, and intoxication. If a covered person is deemed intoxicated, based on legal blood alcohol levels, no benefits are payable. Similarly, treatments deemed not medically necessary are excluded from coverage. Mental illness and substance abuse treatments are generally not covered, except under specific benefit provisions listed elsewhere in the plan.

Further exclusions include losses due to narcotic influence unless prescribed by a physician, and medical conditions resulting from overdose unless treated under medical advice. Pregnancy-related treatments, except in life-threatening situations, are not covered, with exceptions for newborn care under specific provisions. Lastly, no benefits are payable for losses incurred during military service, including non-military support roles in armed forces activities.

8.summary:
This document outlines specific exclusions and limitations associated with the insurance plan. It details that no benefits are payable for manipulations of the musculoskeletal system or acupuncture, particularly when related to nerve interference or subluxation of the vertebral column. Sports-related injuries, especially those from intercollegiate or professional athletics, are not covered, although local community sports activities are excluded from this limitation. Additionally, losses caused by suicide or intentional injury, even if unintended, are not covered.

The document specifies that accidents involving an unlicensed driver are not covered unless the driver holds a valid learner's permit and is receiving instruction. Losses due to war, riots, or insurrection, whether declared or undeclared, are also excluded. Weight-related treatments, including surgeries and nutritional counseling, are not covered unless deemed medically necessary.

Workers' compensation-related medical conditions are excluded from coverage. Pre-existing conditions are not covered for a continuous period of 12 months, except for newborn or adopted children. A waiting period is required before certain benefits become payable, with specific provisions for newborn or adopted children. These exclusions and limitations are crucial for understanding the scope of coverage provided by the insurance plan.

presentation.content:
# Cover
- **Plan Name:** Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance
- **Tagline:** "Predictable Benefits for Your Healthcare Needs"

# Plan Overview
- **Target Audience:** Individuals seeking fixed indemnity insurance solutions
- **Offerings:** Structured healthcare coverage with fixed benefits for specific medical services
- **Key Benefits:** Wide provider network, reduced out-of-pocket costs, predictable healthcare expenses

# Core Plan Elements
## Slide 1
- **Coverage Areas:** Physician services, hospitalization, virtual visits
- **Plan Structure:** Tiered options with varying benefits and coverage limits
- **Eligibility:** Individuals, guaranteed issue, affordability focus

## Slide 2
- **Coverage Details:** 
  - Hospital and ICU confinement benefits
  - Emergency room visits
  - Surgery and anesthesia coverage
- **Eligibility Criteria:** No medical underwriting, pre-existing condition limitations apply

# Common Service Features
## Slide 1
- **Provider Networks:** Access to Multiplan PPO Network for a wide range of healthcare providers
- **Claims Management:** Direct payment of benefits, fast claims process

## Slide 2
- **Support Tools:** Wellness programs, advocacy services, and member dashboards

# Plan Tiers Breakdown
## Plan 100
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $100
  - ICU Confinement: $200
  - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
  - Outpatient Benefits: Limited to physician's office visits

## Plan 200
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $200
  - ICU Confinement: $200
  - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
  - Outpatient Benefits: Includes X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostics

## Plan 200+
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $200
  - ICU Confinement: $200
  - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
  - Outpatient Benefits: Includes X-rays, labs, advanced diagnostics, and surgery coverage

## Plan 300
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $300
  - ICU Confinement: $300
  - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
  - Outpatient Benefits: Includes X-rays, labs, advanced diagnostics, and surgery coverage

## Plan 500
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $500
  - ICU Confinement: $500
  - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
  - Outpatient Benefits: Includes X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostics

## Plan 750
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $750
  - ICU Confinement: $750
  - Emergency Room: $75 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit
  - Outpatient Benefits: Includes X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostics

## Plan 1000
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $1000
  - ICU Confinement: $1000
  - Emergency Room: $100 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $75 per visit
  - Outpatient Benefits: Includes X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostics

## Plan 1000+
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $1000
  - ICU Confinement: $1000
  - Emergency Room: $100 per visit
  - Hospital Admission: $1000 per admission
  - Physician's Office: $75 per visit
  - Outpatient Benefits: Includes X-rays, labs, advanced diagnostics, and surgery coverage

# Comparison Slides
| Feature                      | Plan 100 | Plan 200 | Plan 200+ | Plan 300 | Plan 500 | Plan 750 | Plan 1000 | Plan 1000+ |
|------------------------------|----------|----------|-----------|----------|----------|----------|-----------|------------|
| Hospital Confinement         | $100     | $200     | $200      | $300     | $500     | $750     | $1000     | $1000      |
| ICU Confinement              | $200     | $200     | $200      | $300     | $500     | $750     | $1000     | $1000      |
| Emergency Room               | $50      | $50      | $50       | $50      | $50      | $75      | $100      | $100       |
| Physician's Office           | $50      | $50      | $50       | $50      | $50      | $50      | $75       | $75        |
| Outpatient Benefits          | Limited  | X-rays, labs, diagnostics | X-rays, labs, diagnostics, surgery | X-rays, labs, diagnostics, surgery | X-rays, labs, diagnostics | X-rays, labs, diagnostics | X-rays, labs, diagnostics | X-rays, labs, diagnostics, surgery |
| Hospital Admission           | N/A      | N/A      | N/A       | N/A      | N/A      | N/A      | N/A       | $1000      |

# Limitations and Exclusions
## Slide 1
- **Exclusions:** Pre-existing conditions, chiropractic and acupuncture services, cosmetic surgery, dental care except for accidental injury

## Slide 2
- **Limitations:** Waiting periods, exclusions for hazardous activities, illegal acts, and certain sports-related injuries

# Key Takeaways and Action Steps
- **Flexibility:** Multiple plan tiers to suit different needs
- **Cost vs. Coverage:** Balance between affordability and coverage
- **Next Steps:** Enrollment process, contact support for assistance

# Thank You
- **Message:** Thank you for considering Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance. We look forward to serving your healthcare needs.

slides.content:
--- id: FEN_everest_reinsurance theme: ../../ title: | Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance info: | ## Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance Review A look at the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance benefits and details. verticalCenter: true layout: intro themeConfig: logoHeader: ./img/logos/FEN_logo.svg audioEnabled: true transition: fade-out drawings: persist: false --- # Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance Review Understanding the details and benefits of the **Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance with Multiplan PPO Network** --- transition: fade-out layout: default --- ## Everest Reinsurance Overview - Offered through **NCE** - **Fixed Indemnity Insurance** for specific medical services - **Multiplan PPO Network** and support tools - **Wide range of healthcare providers** through network - **Structured approach** to healthcare coverage --- transition: fade-out layout: default --- ## Key Features and Benefits **Fixed Payments** **Supplemental Coverage** **Direct Payment of Benefits** **Fast Claims Process** (varies by plan) **Multiplan PPO Network** through Everest

script.content:
---- Cover ----

Hello, everyone! Thank you for joining today's session on the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance. We'll walk through this plan's features and benefits, designed to provide predictable benefits for your healthcare needs. Let's get started!

---- Everest Reinsurance Overview ----

The Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance is offered through NCE. 

This plan provides Fixed Indemnity Insurance, which means you receive a set payment amount for specific medical services. 

It includes access to the Multiplan PPO Network and various support tools. 

With a wide range of healthcare providers available through the network, you can enjoy a structured approach to healthcare coverage.

Now, let's explore the key features and benefits of this plan.

---- Key Features and Benefits ----

This plan offers fixed payments, providing you with predictable healthcare expenses. 

It serves as supplemental coverage, helping to reduce out-of-pocket costs. 

The plan ensures direct payment of benefits, with a fast claims process that varies by plan. 

Additionally, the Multiplan PPO Network through Everest enhances your access to healthcare services.

Let's move on to the cost management tools available with this plan.

---- Cost Management Tools ----

The Multiplan PPO Network, or MPN, is a key component of this plan. 

It features a direct payment system, simplifying the payment process for covered services. 

Fast claims support is also available, ensuring that your claims are processed efficiently.

Next, we'll discuss how the Multiplan PPO Network works.

---- How Multiplan PPO Network Works ----

To begin, you enroll through NCE. 

Once enrolled, you gain access to a wide range of providers within the network. 

You can utilize network discounts to further reduce your healthcare costs. 

Upon enrollment, you will receive an MPN card. 

Present this card at your provider's office to benefit from reduced out-of-pocket costs.

Now, let's look at the preventive care and wellness options.

---- Preventive Care and Wellness ----

The plan includes routine checkup services to help maintain your health. 

Wellness programs are also available, offering initiatives to support your well-being. 

The Multiplan PPO Network provides access to a variety of care options to support your health journey.

Let's explore the telehealth services next.

---- Telehealth Services ----

With this plan, you have 24/7 access to healthcare professionals. 

Virtual consultations are available, allowing you to connect with providers from the comfort of your home. 

Remote monitoring services are also offered, providing convenient access to care when you need it.

Now, let's discuss the advocacy and support services.

---- Advocacy and Support Services ----

The plan includes personalized healthcare advocacy to assist you in navigating your healthcare needs. 

Claims assistance support is available to help with any questions or issues you may encounter. 

You can explore various benefit options to find the best fit for your needs. 

Provider support services are also included, ensuring you have the help you need.

Let's examine our first plan tier, Plan 100.

---- Plan 100 (One of Two) ----

Plan 100 offers confinement benefits, including thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Hospital confinement benefits are set at one hundred dollars, while ICU confinement is two hundred dollars. 

Hospital benefits include coverage for two emergency room visits per certificate year. 

Outpatient benefits cover three physician's office visits per certificate year.

Continuing with Plan 100, let's look at the procedure benefits.

---- Plan 100 (Two of Two) ----

Plan 100 does not include coverage for surgery or anesthesia. 

Lab and X-ray services are also not covered under this plan.

Now, let's look at our second plan tier, Plan 200.

---- Plan 200 (One of Two) ----

Plan 200 provides confinement benefits similar to Plan 100, with thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Hospital confinement benefits are two hundred dollars, and ICU confinement is also two hundred dollars. 

Hospital benefits include two emergency room visits per certificate year. 

Outpatient benefits cover X-rays and labs for four covered days per certificate year, advanced diagnostics, and three physician's office visits per certificate year.

Continuing with Plan 200, let's explore the procedure benefits.

---- Plan 200 (Two of Two) ----

Plan 200 does not include coverage for surgery or anesthesia. 

However, lab and X-ray services are covered at fifty dollars each.

Now, let's look at our third plan tier, Plan 300.

---- Plan 300 (One of Two) ----

Plan 300 offers confinement benefits with thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Hospital confinement benefits are three hundred dollars, and ICU confinement is also three hundred dollars. 

Hospital benefits include two emergency room visits per certificate year. 

Outpatient benefits cover three physician's office visits per certificate year.

Continuing with Plan 300, let's examine the procedure benefits.

---- Plan 300 (Two of Two) ----

Plan 300 includes coverage for surgery and anesthesia at twenty-five percent. 

Lab and X-ray services are not covered under this plan.

Let's compare the different tiers available.

---- Comparing the Plans ----

In this table, we compare the features of Plan 100, Plan 200, and Plan 300. 

All plans have a twelve-month exclusion period for pre-existing conditions and are guaranteed issue. 

Confinement benefits are consistent across all plans, with thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Hospital confinement benefits range from one hundred dollars in Plan 100 to three hundred dollars in Plan 300. 

ICU confinement benefits are two hundred dollars in Plans 100 and 200, and three hundred dollars in Plan 300. 

Emergency room benefits are fifty dollars across all plans. 

Plan 300 includes procedure benefits for surgery and anesthesia at twenty-five percent, while Plans 100 and 200 do not. 

Outpatient benefits vary, with Plan 200 offering additional coverage for X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostics.

Let's review important definitions and limitations.

---- Definitions and Limitations ----

Pre-existing conditions have a twelve-month exclusion period, applying to conditions treated prior to coverage. 

Coverage limits are specified amounts, and policy terms may vary by state. 

Exclusions include no coverage for extreme sports injuries and cosmetic surgery unless medically necessary. 

Additional limitations include no foreign travel coverage unless it's an emergency and excludes services by family members.

Here are the key points to remember.

---- Key Takeaways and Reminders ----

The plan offers fixed indemnity benefits, providing predictable healthcare expenses. 

It includes access to the Multiplan PPO Network, enhancing your healthcare options. 

Direct payment benefits simplify the claims process. 

Enrollment is required to access these benefits.

Thank you for your time today. We hope this information helps you make informed decisions about your health coverage. Continue to be great!

---- Closing ----

Thank you for participating in the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance Review. Continue to be great!

## Plan 300 (2/2)

<v-click>

**Procedure Benefits**
- Surgery: 25%
- Anesthesia: 25%
<Arrow v-bind="{ x1:480, y1:370, x2:560, y2:370, color: 'var(--slidev-theme-accent)' }" />
</v-click>

<v-click>

**Lab and X-Rays**
- Lab: N/A
- X-Rays: N/A
<Arrow v-bind="{ x1:480, y1:410, x2:560, y2:410, color: 'var(--slidev-theme-accent)' }" />
</v-click>
slide.frontmatter:
transition: fade-out
layout: one-half-img
image: img/pages/plan_brochure_image_1.jpg

script.content:
Plan 300 includes coverage for surgery and anesthesia at twenty-five percent. 

Lab and X-ray services are not covered under this plan.

Let's compare the different tiers available.

slide.content:
## Comparing the Plans

| **Feature** | **Plan 100** | **Plan 200** | **Plan 300** |
|---------|----------|----------|-----------|
| Benefit Eligibility | 12-12 Pre-Existing Conditions | 12-12 Pre-Existing Conditions | 12-12 Pre-Existing Conditions |
| Underwriting Level | Guaranteed Issue | Guaranteed Issue | Guaranteed Issue |
| Confinement Benefits | 30 Days Per Confinement/90 Days Per Certificate Year | 30 Days Per Confinement/90 Days Per Certificate Year | 30 Days Per Confinement/90 Days Per Certificate Year |
| Hospital Confinement | $100 | $200 | $300 |
| ICU Confinement | $200 | $200 | $300 |
| Hospital Benefits | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year |
| Hospital Admission | N/A | N/A | N/A |
| Emergency Room | $50 | $50 | $50 |
| Procedure Benefits | N/A | N/A | 25% |
| Surgery | N/A | N/A | 25% |
| Anesthesia | N/A | N/A | 25% |
| Outpatient Benefits | Physician's Office-3 per certificate year | X-Rays & Labs-4 covered days per certificate year/Advanced Diagnostic-covered days per certificate year/Physician's Office-3 per certificate year | Physician's Office-3 per certificate year |
| Lab | N/A | $50 | N/A |
| X-Rays | N/A | $50 | N/A |
| Advanced Diagnostic | N/A | $50 | N/A |
| Physician's Office | $50 | $50 | $50 |

script.content:
In this table, we compare the features of Plan 100, Plan 200, and Plan 300. 

All plans have a twelve-month exclusion period for pre-existing conditions and are guaranteed issue. 

Confinement benefits are consistent across all plans, with thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Hospital confinement benefits range from one hundred dollars in Plan 100 to three hundred dollars in Plan 300. 

ICU confinement benefits are two hundred dollars in Plans 100 and 200, and three hundred dollars in Plan 300. 

Emergency room benefits are fifty dollars across all plans. 

Plan 300 includes procedure benefits for surgery and anesthesia at twenty-five percent, while Plans 100 and 200 do not. 

Outpatient benefits vary, with Plan 200 offering additional coverage for X-rays, labs, and advanced diagnostics.

Let's review important definitions and limitations.

slide.content:
## Definitions and Limitations

<v-click>

**Pre-existing Conditions**
- 12-month exclusion period
- Applies to conditions treated prior to coverage
- No chiropractic or acupuncture coverage
<Arrow v-bind="{ x1:480, y1:160, x2:550, y2:160, color: 'var(--slidev-theme-accent)' }" />
</v-click>

<v-click>

**Coverage Limits**
- Benefits limited to specified amounts
- Policy terms vary by state
<Arrow v-bind="{ x1:480, y1:255, x2:550, y2:255, color: 'var(--slidev-theme-accent)' }" />
</v-click>

<v-click>

**Exclusions**
- No coverage for extreme sports injuries
- Excludes cosmetic surgery unless medically necessary
<Arrow v-bind="{ x1:480, y1:360, x2:550, y2:360, color: 'var(--slidev-theme-accent)' }" />
</v-click>

<v-click>

**Additional Limitations**
- No foreign travel coverage unless emergency
- Excludes services by family members
<Arrow v-bind="{ x1:480, y1:420, x2:550, y2:420, color: 'var(--slidev-theme-accent)' }" />
</v-click>
slide.frontmatter:
transition: fade-out
layout: one-half-img
image: img/pages/plan_brochure_image_final.jpg

script.content:
Pre-existing conditions have a twelve-month exclusion period, applying to conditions treated prior to coverage. 

Coverage limits are specified amounts, and policy terms may vary by state. 

Exclusions include no coverage for extreme sports injuries and cosmetic surgery unless medically necessary. 

Additional limitations include no foreign travel coverage unless it's an emergency and excludes services by family members.

Here are the key points to remember.

slide.content:
## Key Takeaways and Reminders

<v-clicks>

- **Fixed Indemnity** benefits
- **Multiplan PPO Network** included
- **Direct Payment** benefits
- **Enrollment** required

</v-clicks>

script.content:
The plan offers fixed indemnity benefits, providing predictable healthcare expenses. 

It includes access to the Multiplan PPO Network, enhancing your healthcare options. 

Direct payment benefits simplify the claims process. 

Enrollment is required to access these benefits.

Thank you for your time today. We hope this information helps you make informed decisions about your health coverage. Continue to be great!

slide.content: # Thank You! Continue to be great!
slide.frontmatter:
transition: fade-out
layout: end
line: Thank you for participating in the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance Review. Continue to be great!

script.content: Thank you for participating in the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance Review. Continue to be great!
